result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine LaShawn Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence. Credit for 5 days.
Court will allow transfer of probation to any other state.

miscConds.notes:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: - 1 YEAR condition time.  First 5 months straigh time, remainder with Huber and Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 06/10/2016 by 5pm.

CORRECTION  AS TO ORDER OF AUGUST 8, 2016: 
Entry should read:  Order DENYING Expedited Release signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Order GRANTING Expedited Release signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.

Defendant's pro se request for expedited release privileges.
Added assessments and corrected eligibility for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Antoine LaShawn Williams in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Court will allow transfer of probation to any other state.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 1 YEAR condition time.  First 5 months straigh time, remainder with Huber and Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 06/10/2016 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Antoine LaShawn Williams in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Student Intern Carlos Pedraza under the supervision of Zachary A Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 04/04/2016 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
